dbRoll.description: Roll a die with a recorded statistic
dbRoll.name: dbroll

options.character: The character where to take the value.

error.emptyDamage: You have no ability dice saved.
error.mustBeGreater: The {{value}} value must be greater than {{min}}
error.mustBeLower: The {{value}} value must be smaller than {{max}}
error.noDice: You cannot issue this command without having a registered die type!
error.noStats: This command cannot be used: no statistics have been recorded.
error.noThread: No thread found - Please re-register user if thread has been deleted
error.tooMuchStats: You cannot have more than 20 statistics
error.totalExceededBy: The total of {{value}} is exceeded by {{max}}

generate.help:
- The die type must be a valid type (it will be tested when you save the model).
- The value must be a number, and may be optional. If you remove it, the die will be compared to the statistic rather than a value.
- Total must be a number, and may be optional. If you remove it, the total will be calculated automatically when the user is registered.
- The formula is used to edit the combined value of the die. Use `$` to symbolize the value (ie: `+$`, `-$`, `($-10)/2`...).
- A stat can be a combination of other stats, such as `strength+endurance`. If the `combination` value is set, then the `min` and `max` parameters will be disabled. In addition, users won't have to enter the value manually. Finally, this value will be excluded from the calculation of the point total allocated.
- You can also register skill dice, which will then be used for the `/dbd` command from the database. In addition, users can register their own skill dice.

Please note that the file shown here is only an example, and must be customized before being saved.

It is possible to save only skill dice, or nothing at all, if you wish to use only the skill dice commands.
generate.name: generate

character.description: Make character name mandatory for registration
character.name: character

damage.description: Register a competence die - Separate competence names with a space or comma
damage.name: competence

stats.name: name

total.description: The total of the statistics points (will be calculated when the user is registered)
total.name: total

help.message:
:game_die: **Dice Roller** :game_die:
-> Find the *bot* on [GitHub](<https://github.com/Lisandra-dev/dice-thread/blob/main/README.md>)

## Usage
- </roll:{{rollId}}> : Roll a die
- </scene:{{sceneId}}> : Creates a new thread for dice. This will archive all previous threads.

You can also create a "time bubble" with the parameters `/scene tempo:True`. By default, the thread name will be the current date.

You can use the bot directly in a message (**without using slash commands**), with :
- __A direct die__ : `des`, like `d6` or `2d6`.
- __An indirect die__ : `my message [dice]`, like `*Phibi jumps on Wumpus and inflicts [2d6] damage*`.
- __A semi-direct die__: `1d100 my message`, as `1d100 Phibi jumps on Wumpus and inflicts damage`.

## Dice notation
[See documentation for dice notation](<https://dice-roller.github.io/documentation/guide/notation/dice.html>).

The bot also supports:
- [Dice groups](<https://dice-roller.github.io/documentation/guide/notation/group-rolls.html>)
- [Modifiers](<https://dice-roller.github.io/documentation/guide/notation/modifiers.html>)
- [Comments](<https://dice-roller.github.io/documentation/guide/notation/roll-descriptions.html>)
- [Math](<https://dice-roller.github.io/documentation/guide/notation/maths.html>)
- As well as "bulk rolls" (throwing several dice at the same time) with the following notation: `[number of dice]#[dice]`, for example `2#d6` to throw 2 6-sided dice.of dice]#
